data.title: Blue Line Metro Bangalore: Stations, Map, Timing and Route 2024
data.meta_description: Explore the game-changing influence of Bangalore's Blue Line Metro, uniting vital regions, enhancing accessibility, and reshaping the way people commute.
data.text:
Are you tired of endless traffic jams and long airport commutes in Bengaluru? The "Blue Line Metro Bangalore" offers the solution you've been seeking. In a city where time is precious and traffic is a daily struggle, discover how the upcoming Blue Line Metro is set to revolutionise your daily commute and airport travel. Let's dive into the details of this mass rapid transit system, its two phases, and the promise it holds to reduce travel time significantly. Join us on this journey to explore how the Blue Line Metro will transform the way you move in Bangalore.

Metro Blue Line Bangalore Stations with Map

Stretching across 58.19 kilometres and encompassing 30 metro stations, the Blue Metro Line Bangalore is a colossal undertaking. This ambitious project is divided into two phases, 2A and 2B, with the latter focusing on providing an airport connection.

The anticipated Bangalore metro blue line completion date is June 2026. The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL) is spearheading this transformative endeavour, a collaborative effort between the State and Union governments.

Here is a detailed description of the stations on the Blue Line:

Terminal Stations

KR Puram: Interchange station with the Purple Line, located in the eastern part of the city.

Kempegowda International Airport Terminal: Terminal of the Kempegowda International Airport.

Major Stations

Mahadevpura: IT hub in the northern part of the city.

Bellandur: IT hub and residential area in the eastern part of the city.

Hebbal: Interchange station with the future Orange Line, located in the northern part of the city.

Horamavu: Residential area in the eastern part of the city.

Marathahalli: IT hub and residential area in the eastern part of the city.

Silk Board: Commercial and residential area in the southern part of the city.

Intersection Stations

KR Puram (interchange with Purple Line)

Nagawara (interchange with Pink Line)

Hebbal (interchange with future Orange Line)

Here is a complete list of metro Blue Line route:

Embark on a transformative journey along the dynamic Blue Line Metro in Bangalore. The commute from KR Puram to Kodibisanahalli takes just 44 minutes, and the fare is a mere ₹19.00. In addition, the route from Kasturinagara to Bettahalasuru offers a convenient 1-hour and 12-minute journey for ₹295.00. Discover the ease and efficiency of the Blue Line Metro as it connects you seamlessly across Bangalore. At an incredibly budget-friendly fare, this metro line effortlessly threads its way through the city, ensuring a remarkable blend of convenience and connectivity.

Blue Line Metro Operating Timings

Namma Metro in Bangalore ensures efficient travel with its well-planned schedule. Trains run daily from 5 am to 11 pm at intervals ranging from 4 to 20 minutes, catering to the diverse needs of commuters throughout the day.

On the second and fourth Saturdays or public holidays, the metro services begin at 6 am, providing extra convenience for weekend travelers, and conclude at 10:35 pm. Sundays are equally accommodating, with services starting at 7 am and operating until 11 pm.

These thoughtfully designed timings ensure that the metro is accessible when you need it, making daily commutes and weekend outings hassle-free.

Blue Line Metro Fare

In Bangalore, the metro service stands out as the most convenient and cost-effective mode of transportation. The minimum metro rail fare for Reach 1 stretch is just Rs. 10, making it an incredibly affordable option for daily commuters and occasional travelers alike. Even at its maximum fare of Rs. 17, the metro remains budget-friendly, ensuring your wallet stays content while you navigate the city hassle-free.

Not only does the metro save you from the stress of traffic jams, but it also offers the assurance of staying within your budget. It's not only affordable for daily commuting but also contributes to reducing the overall cost of living in Bangalore. It's a pocket-friendly choice that doesn't compromise on comfort, providing you with an efficient and economical way to travel around Bangalore. So, as you enjoy the convenience of the metro, you can also take pride in making a smart financial decision.

Bangalore Metro Smart Tickets

When it comes to Bangalore Metro, you have two smart ticket options to make your journey hassle-free. There are distinct fare structures for each of these choices.

Smart Tokens

For a mere Rs. 10, you can acquire Smart Tokens, and each token grants you access to a single journey. To enter the metro, tap your token at the designated pad near the entry gates, and after your ride, simply drop it into the provided slot at the Exit Stations.

Contactless Smart Cards

Contactless Smart Cards are designed for multiple journeys. While the minimum cost for the card is Rs. 50, the travel value differs. These cards come with attractive discounts ranging from 15% to 23%, making them a cost-effective alternative to tokens.

Varshik and Sanchar Cards

The "Varshik" card is a rechargeable option that can store credit up to Rs. 1,500. Swipe it at the main entry and exit points, and your fare is automatically deducted, starting at a minimum fare of Rs. 8.50.

The "Sanchar" card is a multi-trip card suitable for up to 100 trips between fixed points. It caters to regular commuters, such as office-goers and students. Fares are even more economical, with a minimum fare of Rs. 7.65 for a minimum purchase of 100 trips.

Group Tickets

Group Tickets, available in paper form, cater to groups of ten members travelling between the same stations.

Metro-Bus Ticket (MBT) Day Pass

The MBT Day Pass is an integrated ticket, granting unlimited travel on both metro and non-air-conditioned buses for the entire day for Smart Card holders. The "Saral" ticket costs Rs. 110 and includes travel on air-conditioned buses (except Airport buses). The "Saraag" ticket, priced at Rs. 70, is exclusively for metro and non-air-conditioned buses.

Combo Cards

SBI issues Combo Cards, which serve as SBI Debit-cum-Transit cards. These cards offer the convenience of loading either value or trips, providing a 15% to 21% discount compared to token rates.

Multiple Tickets in a Card

This smart card offers the flexibility of holding Varshik, Sanchar, and MBT tickets all in one, with Varshik being the default ticket type.

Bangalore Metro Ticket Outlets – Easily Accessible

Bangalore Metro provides various ticket sale outlets. Tickets can be purchased at station ticket counters, ticket vending machines (TVM), and soon at TVMs. MBT Day passes are available at select bus stations and buses near Reach 1. Combo Cards can be obtained from SBI branches where commuters have bank accounts.

Top-ups for smart cards (with Varshik or Sanchar tickets) are possible at Metro stations, TVMs, Airtel retail outlets, and the BMRCL website. For Varshik ticket top-ups on Metro and Combo cards, you can use SBI ATMs, SBI net banking, SBI mobile banking, or set up auto top-up through SBI standing instructions.

The Metro Ride app – Enhancing Last-Mile Connectivity

In addition to expanding the metro network, efforts are underway to improve access to and from metro stations. The Metro Ride app offers an efficient and cost-effective solution for commuters travelling between their homes and metro stations or their final destinations.

The service covers 66 metro stations on the Green Line and Purple Line in Bangalore. To book a ride to the metro station, you can use the app on your Android or iPhone. This app is available for free download, providing a convenient way to enhance your metro travel experience.

The Whatsapp Bot

To further streamline metro travel in Bengaluru, the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL) has unveiled QR ticketing via WhatsApp. This pioneering service empowers Namma Metro passengers to bypass lengthy queues and access an array of metro-related services directly through their WhatsApp chats.

Steps to Acquire QR Tickets on WhatsApp:

Step 1: Initiate WhatsApp and send 'hi' to +91 81055 56677.

Step 2: Click on the QR Tickets option.

Step 3: Opt to purchase a ticket, cancel a booking, or review recent journeys.

Step 4: Specify your embarkation station by sharing your location or entering the station name manually.

Step 5: Indicate your chosen route: Green Line or Purple Line.

Step 6: Select your destination station.

Step 7: Scrutinise the booking details and proceed by clicking.

Step 8: Facilitate payment through WhatsApp Pay or other digital methods.

Upon a successful transaction, your QR ticket will materialise on the screen, poised for scanning at the metro station's entry and exit points.

This novel service also extends the convenience of accessing transit schedules and Bangalore metro blue line updated fare structures, offering a seamless and efficient means to simplify your travel experience in the city.

Latest News Updates on Blue Line Metro Bangalore

Phase 2A of the Namma Metro in Bangalore spans a total of 18.236 kilometres, consisting primarily of an elevated line. On the other hand, Phase 2B encompasses a more extensive stretch of 39 kilometres. The initiation of construction for Phase 2A commenced in the year 2021, with anticipated operational commencement around June 2025.

Regarding Phase 2B's development within the Namma Metro Bangalore framework, construction efforts were set into motion in February 2022. The timeline for its completion is projected to extend until approximately June 2026.

Residential Areas Near These Stations

The Blue Line Metro in Bangalore is poised to establish a vital connection between the eastern suburbs and the burgeoning IT hubs, promising seamless connectivity that is anticipated to fuel demand for residential real estate ventures in the vicinity. Property rates in the Mahadevpura region, situated along Blue Line Phase 2A, have displayed a steady increase over the past five years.

Furthermore, areas such as the prominent tech hubs ISRO and the DRDO Sports Complex are expected to alleviate traffic congestion, enhancing their appeal. The upcoming airport line, Phase 2B, is set to interlink various parts of north Bangalore, potentially attracting greater investments into the commercial property sector soon.

Moreover, the ribbon development planned along this corridor is poised to draw homebuyers with the promise of enhanced employment opportunities, consequently boosting the residential segment of the real estate market. Additionally, the implementation of Namma Metro is set to significantly reduce travel times, thereby opening up more avenues for redevelopment activities in the surrounding metro areas.

Explore more on that in our comprehensive blog on Property Rates in Bangalore.

Below is the list of major residential neighbourhoods around Blue Line metro Bangalore

Mahadevpura

Located in the northern part of Bangalore, Mahadevapura is a thriving IT hub and a sought-after residential area. It is known for its proximity to numerous tech parks and employment opportunities, making it an ideal choice for IT professionals and their families.

Bellandur

Situated in the eastern part of the city, Bellandur is renowned as a bustling IT hub and a prime residential area. With its close proximity to major tech companies and a vibrant social scene, it has become a popular choice for young professionals and families.

Hebbal

Positioned in the northern part of Bangalore, Hebbal is an emerging residential area with significant growth potential. Its strategic location as an interchange station for the future Orange Line makes it an attractive choice for those seeking connectivity and investment opportunities.

Marathahalli

In the eastern part of the city, Marathahalli stands out as a prominent IT hub and a thriving residential area. Its proximity to major tech parks, educational institutions, and shopping centres makes it a favoured location for IT professionals and families alike.

Yelahanka

Yelahanka, situated in the northern part of Bangalore, is a well-established residential area known for its serene ambiance and excellent connectivity. With numerous schools, colleges, and parks, it is a preferred choice for families seeking a peaceful yet well-connected neighbourhood.

Please note that specific real estate data and trends may change over time, so it's advisable to consult updated sources for the most current information about these areas.
